final_answer.precision_note: Result given to 3 significant figures, matching the precision of input values (1.50 A, 30.0 min, F = 96500 C mol-1, Cu = 63.55).

method: First convert time to seconds: 30.0 min × 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge using Q = I × t = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q/F = 2700 C / 96500 C mol-1 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of Cu, so n(Cu) = 0.02798/2 = 0.01399 mol. Finally, mass of Cu = n × Ar(Cu) = 0.01399 mol × 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
checks: Faraday calculation check: 2700 C / 96500 C mol-1 = 0.02798 mol e-, divided by 2 gives 0.01399 mol Cu, times 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
